trans-unit.source: Review
trans-unit.target: Review

trans-unit.source: Here is a brief review of the topics we covered in lessons 7–12.
trans-unit.target: Here is a brief review of the topics we covered in lessons 7–12.

trans-unit.source: Coordinate Grid and LEDs
trans-unit.target: Coordinate Grid and LEDs

trans-unit.source: The micro:bit’s 25 LEDs are arranged in a 5x5 grid, with the origin at the top left.
trans-unit.target: The micro:bit’s 25 LEDs are arranged in a 5x5 grid, with the origin at the top left.

trans-unit.source: Values for both the x and y axes start at zero and increase as you move down and to the right.
trans-unit.target: Values for both the x and y axes start at zero and increase as you move down and to the right.

trans-unit.source: Individual LEDs can be turned off and on by specifying a pair of coordinates.
trans-unit.target: Individual LEDs can be turned off and on by specifying a pair of coordinates.

trans-unit.source: The current value of an LED can be checked, and its brightness can be changed, as well.
trans-unit.target: The current value of an LED can be checked, and its brightness can be changed, as well.

trans-unit.source: Booleans
trans-unit.target: ブール値

trans-unit.source: A Boolean is a data type that only has two possible values: True or False.
trans-unit.target: A Boolean is a data type that only has two possible values: True or False.

trans-unit.source: You can use boolean variables to keep track of the state of a game (gameOver is either true or false) or check to see whether a certain action has taken place yet (messageSent is either true or false).
trans-unit.target: You can use boolean variables to keep track of the state of a game (gameOver is either true or false) or check to see whether a certain action has taken place yet (messageSent is either true or false).

trans-unit.source: Boolean operators such as AND OR and NOT allow you to combine boolean expressions to make more complex conditions.
trans-unit.target: Boolean operators such as AND OR and NOT allow you to combine boolean expressions to make more complex conditions.

trans-unit.source: Bits, bytes, and binary
trans-unit.target: Bits, bytes, and binary

trans-unit.source: Computers work with base-2, which uses binary numbers. Binary numbers only have two possible values: 0 or 1.
trans-unit.target: Computers work with base-2, which uses binary numbers. Binary numbers only have two possible values: 0 or 1.

trans-unit.source: Radio communication
trans-unit.target: Radio communication

trans-unit.source: A micro:bits can send a combination of strings and numbers using the Radio blocks.
trans-unit.target: A micro:bits can send a combination of strings and numbers using the Radio blocks.

trans-unit.source: The Infection activity is an example of a thought-provoking group simulation that uses the Radio to send and receive data between micro:bits.
trans-unit.target: The Infection activity is an example of a thought-provoking group simulation that uses the Radio to send and receive data between micro:bits.

trans-unit.source: Arrays
trans-unit.target: Arrays

trans-unit.source: Arrays in MakeCode are used to store and retrieve numbers, strings, musical notes, or sprites.
trans-unit.target: Arrays in MakeCode are used to store and retrieve numbers, strings, musical notes, or sprites.

trans-unit.source: Everything in a particular array needs to be the same data type and elements in an array are numbered starting from zero, also called the index.
trans-unit.target: Everything in a particular array needs to be the same data type and elements in an array are numbered starting from zero, also called the index.

trans-unit.source: Objects can be accessed, changed, added to, or removed from an array using their index.
trans-unit.target: Objects can be accessed, changed, added to, or removed from an array using their index.

trans-unit.source: Three common methods of sorting elements in an array are bubble sort, selection sort, and insertion sort.
trans-unit.target: Three common methods of sorting elements in an array are bubble sort, selection sort, and insertion sort.
